title: Name this type character
content:
I recently saw this character in the fine print of Esquire Magazine. Does this character have a name... so I would be able to search for more info.

(in case the attached image doesn’t show up, it looks like an en dash touching the stem of a capitol D... like: -D with tighter kerning)

 [‹ Pretty Outline Font](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821154746/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42624 "Go to previous forum topic") [Scripty "B" ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821154746/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42615 "Go to next forum topic")
author: ericz

comments.content: I put the image online here: [http://www.typeissexy.com/mystery-d.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821154746/http:/www.typeissexy.com/mystery-d.gif "http://www.typeissexy.com/mystery-d.gif")
Sorry, I wrote that before I saw your image.

This character comes up often for me - when I change fonts in InDesign. It seems to replace the x character that is used for dimensions, as in 8 x 10”. Sometimes it replaces bullets. But I don’t know its name.

Thanks guys!

Eric Z Graphic Design (Print/Web/Interactive)  
 [www.eric-z.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821154746/http:/www.eric-z.com/ "www.eric-z.com")  
 [www.typeissexy.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821154746/http:/www.typeissexy.com/ "www.typeissexy.com")
